return.description:
Returns TRUE if every character in the string
   text is a decimal digit, FALSE otherwise.

notes.description:
This function require a string to be useful, so for example passing
    in an integer will always return FALSE. However, also note that
    HTML Forms will result in numeric strings and not integers. See also the
    types section of the manual.

changelog.change:
Before PHP 5.1.0, this function returned TRUE
        when text was an empty string.
